place.name: APLEY
place.gazetteerText: APLEY, a parish in Lincoln district, Lincoln; near Langworth river, 3¼ miles SW of Wragby, and 5 N of Bardney r. station. Post Town, Wragby. Acres, 1,658. Real property, £1,670. Pop., 221. Houses, 45. The manor belonged to the Tyrwhittses, and descended to the Drakes; and the old mansion on it is now a farmhouse. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £20. Patron, T. T. Drake, Esq. There is no church; but there is a Wesleyan chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
